message:
Hi guys , I just want to know your opinion regarding an idea that I have.

Problem : Sometimes I fed up with Facebook (for productivity reasons) and I decide to kill the news feed or even close the account but at the same time I'm following a lot of great people who publish great beneficial posts and some groups/pages that share hot opportunities and excellent opinions.

Suggested Solution :

Actually the idea isn't very clear yet but I'm thinking about :

A tool that get all the feeds from your favorite sources (groups/pages/Persons) and exposes them through an alternative news feed. 

You can apply some filters on the content so when a new post (from a page that you love) contains "Master Degree Scholarship" is posted , you will get notified.

The content may be pre-processed to remove for example all the politics posts :) in addition to a lot of other things.

Do you also have the same problem ? What are your solutions for it ?
Do you think you could use sth like that if it is free for example ?

data.message: Ignoring the technical solution on purpose, how about another account?

I love the idea from a 10,000ft view. I think I'd definitely use it, because I personally struggle with that a lot. On IG, Twitter and Facebook. Would I pay for it? Yes, but how much? No clue, these kind of services always strike me as a perfect fit for a PWYW model.

I solve this problem by avoiding the news feed completely and really only on notifications, I have a small list of friends where I get notified every time they post, and I make important groups notify me too.
On the rare occasion that I'd like to waste some time, I go and check the news feed.
Well, mainly Facebook newsfeed comes from the pages, people ad groups that you follow. You can simply like the pages, join the groups and add the people who you really want to see their updates

Hi Ahmed,
I already did this
This is currently my 3rd week :)
I unfollowed everyone and did unlike all of the pages I have
I switched to Twitter where I have way more useful content and switched to RSS Readers as well to get content from my favourite places
*I'm here to post something only and saw your post :)*
